sentences.english: For fatal cases, the course of illness takes an average of two days.
sentences.chinese: 就死亡病例而言，病程平均兩天。

sentences.english: Induced accumulation of the acidic pathogenesis-related proteins ( PRs ) in tobacco leaves by ningnanmycin was studied.

sentences.english: He presented with complaints of quadriparesis that had progressed over the course of 2 years.
sentences.chinese: 患者出現四肢輕癱，在兩年病程中逐步加劇。

sentences.english: Yellow fever is difficult to diagnose, especially during the early stages.

sentences.english: It was, therefore, postulated that it could be a new pathogenesis-related protein gene of the potato.

sentences.english: Conclusion Expectorant can shorten the duration of moderate and severe acute exacerbations of asthma in children.

sentences.english: Results The clinical characteristics of IVMF were long course and hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 結果病程長，反覆出血是小腸血管畸形的臨牀特徵。

sentences.english: The doctor may be able to prevent a full-blown episode by making adjustments to the treatment plan.
sentences.chinese: 醫師會調整治療計劃以防止整個病程的到來。

sentences.english: The drugs can shorten the length of the disease and its severity.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種藥物可以縮短病程和減輕症狀。

sentences.english: Corpulmonale is one common disease. The course of this disease is long there will be more syndromes.
sentences.chinese: 肺源性心臟病是一種常見病，病程長，併發症多。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the changes and clinical significance of liver function of patients with tsutsugamushi disease.

sentences.english: Longer course, dysphagia developed to a certain extent that is no longer aggravated .

sentences.english: They are of long duration and generally slow progression.
sentences.chinese: 這類疾病的病程較長，並且通常情況下病程發展緩慢。
